title: Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme
snippet: This article discusses a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the visibility of political content on Facebook. The study highlights a lack of transparency, stating that the algorithmic suppression is less effective against extremists. The study analyzed over 2.5 million Facebook posts published between 2021 and 2025.
description: This article from open.online discusses a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the visibility of political content on Facebook, highlighting a lack of transparency regarding algorithmic suppression against extremists.

title: SOS! Ora l'algoritmo punta sui complottisti: "Intervenire subito!"
snippet: This article refers to a research by the University of Urbino, led by Professor Fabio Giglietto, highlighting that the visibility of posts by Italian parliamentarians on Facebook has decreased significantly between 2021 and 2025, while 'extremist' accounts have increased their visibility. The article quotes Professor Giglietto describing these 'extremists' as Facebook pages and public figures characterized by anti-system narratives, criticism of mainstream media, and skepticism about vaccination policies.
description: This article on byoblu.com discusses research led by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, focusing on the decreased visibility of Italian parliamentarians on Facebook compared to extremist accounts.

title: Più visibilità agli estremisti che ai parlamentari, l'impatto del “filtro” di Meta sulle elezioni
snippet: This article discusses a study titled “Meta's Political Content Reduction Policy and Italian Parliamentarians' Facebook Visibility” by Fabio Giglietto, a professor at the University of Urbino. The study analyzes the impact of Meta's algorithmic 'filter' on the visibility of political content. The article mentions that the study found a significant decrease in the visibility of Italian parliamentarians' posts, while extremist accounts maintained or increased their visibility.
description: This article from ilfattoquotidiano.it discusses a study by Fabio Giglietto regarding the impact of Meta's content reduction policies on the visibility of Italian parliamentarians on Facebook.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - Uniurb
snippet: This page from the University of Urbino website mentions Fabio Giglietto as co-author of a white paper on the Digital Services Act (DSA) and its impact on data access for platform research. It also mentions his role in the vera.ai project and the MINE team's involvement in analyzing disinformation narratives.
description: This University of Urbino webpage mentions Fabio Giglietto as co-author of a white paper on the Digital Services Act (DSA) and mentions his involvement in the vera.ai project and the MINE team's work on disinformation narratives.

title: SOS! ORA L’ALGORITMO PUNTA SUI ‘COMPLOTTISTI’: “INTERVENIRE SUBITO!” - ByoBlu
MENO POLITICA SU META, ESTREMISTI IN VANTAGGIO - 9Colonne
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: This article discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentation of collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni, exploring the use of large language models (LLMs) to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. It also mentions his moderation of a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era, and another presentation on mapping polarization and political narratives in Brazilian Facebook groups.
description: The article discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentation of research on disinformation and digital manipulation at conferences in Brazil, focusing on the use of LLMs to analyze political discourse and mapping polarization in Facebook groups. It also mentions his moderation of a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era.

title: ChatGpt va all’università, la promozione delle big tech per fidelizzare gli studenti all’uso dell’Ai - Il Sole 24 ORE

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
